programmes.show_description: Treasures to Die For: Exploring Hartwood, a haunting facility in Scotland, ruins of an ancient city in Iraq and a scandal hit town in New Mexico.
Niagara's Hidden Marvel: Exploring a royal retreat caught in a web of corruption, an engineering marvel hidden behind the Niagara Falls in Canada, and a subterranean treasure.
US Ships: The story of America's 'Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.
Shopping from Home.
Kamloops to Calgary: Michael Portillo boards one of the world's most famous trains, the Rocky Mountaineer, to cross the backbone of the North American continent.
Halifax to Prince Edward Island: Michael Portillo begins a new journey on the tracks of the Ocean line to explore Canada's maritime provinces, en route to Quebec City.
Saab 99: Gus and Will seek a Scandinavian car and settle on a Saab. They'd prefer a classic 99, but can only find an older 99 that was bought for a rally but can't go the distance.
Rover: Gus and Will set out to buy a Honda-based Rover 800 coupe. At only 650 pounds it seems too good to be true - and when they turn up, they aren't sure whether to proceed.
Citroen XM: Gus has his eye on a Citroen XM that looks amazing - but it's in France. Will isn't sure, but the engineering challenges win him over.
Audi TT: Gus and Will find an Audi Quattro roadster than has seen better days - it's full of problems, and hasn't been serviced in years. Even so, they are intent on renovating it.
Philadelphia to Gettysburg: Michael Portillo travels through Philadelphia, and pays tribute its most famous fictional son, Rocky Balboa.
Wilmington to Fort McHenry: Michael Portillo reaches the boundary between the northern and southern states - the Mason-Dixon line.
Oxford to Reading: Robbie's narrowboat gets a makeover before he explores the River Thames, he moors in Abingdon and tackles an emergency DIY repair to fix a leak.
Reading to Windsor: Robbie visits a former Beatle's home in Henley, uncovers horror history in Marlow and struggles to find a mooring in Maidenhead on the River Thames.
Africa: Author and broadcaster Simon Reeve travels around the equator, beginning by visiting African countries including Gabon and Kenya.
Indonesia: Simon Reeve heads to Indonesia, the world's largest archipelagic nation - home to 220 million people speaking 700 different languages on a collection of 18,000 islands.
Latin America: Simon Reeve visits South America, where he learns how the Galapagos Islands are under threat from tourists and meets remote indigenous tribes in Brazil.
Porsche 911: Irv imports an original-run short wheelbase Porsche 911 from the east coast of America. He needs to make it roadworthy, while keeping its incredible sun-faded patina.

MG Magnette/Morris Minor/De Tomaso Longchamp/Ford Escort Rally Car: Derek collects a pair of stylish British classics from a Yorkshire workshop, with the Morris 1000 finding a new home with a 10-year-
Mexico / Riley Kestrel: A 1973 Ford Escort Mexico is the team's most expensive purchase to date. To save some cash Derek helps on their second buy - a 1968 Riley Kestrel.

Datsun 240Z/Rover Mini Cooper: Derek picks up some emerging sporting classics from the far east when three Datsun Zs appear, and an unusual lot arrives that run on caterpillar tracks not wheels. S3 Ep
Fiat X1/9 / Austin A60 Cambridge: There's real Yorkshire drama when Derek sells vehicles from TV show Heartbeat, love for an Austin Cambridge, and a sporty Italian number getting rehomed.
Capri 1300L/Honda S800: A rare Honda S800 sports car from 1967 takes Derek's fancy, and a couple of very different Ford Capris with long histories go head-to-head at the auction.
Morris Traveller / Subaru Impreza P: The Mathewsons sell a 1958 Bedford D122 and a 1969 Vanden Plas Princess, and meet a collector who may be willing to part with a huge hot hatch collection.
Ford RS2000/Austin Healey Sprite: There is a triple collection of desirable cars in store for Derek when an MG Midget, an Austin-Healey 'frogeye' Sprite and an RS2000 come up for auction.
Shopping from Home.
Springhill Junction to Quebec City: Michael Portillo continues his journey to Quebec City, during which he investigates the world's biggest tide.
Sainte-Anne-de-Beaupre to Winnipeg: Michael Portillo explores the Province of Quebec, taking the Charlevoix train along the bank of the St Lawrence River to La Malbaie.
Oxford to Reading: Robbie's narrowboat gets a makeover before he explores the River Thames, he moors in Abingdon and tackles an emergency DIY repair to fix a leak.
Reading to Windsor: Robbie visits a former Beatle's home in Henley, uncovers horror history in Marlow and struggles to find a mooring in Maidenhead on the River Thames.
New. Paul and Suki head to Wales - where the roads make Paul nervous - as they pitch up at its biggest natural lake and try paddle boarding and synchronised swimming.
New. Suki and Paul are in Yorkshire as they stay at the famous Tan Hill Inn, arrange a sheep dog training session, and visit the incredible Ribblehead Viaduct.
To the Ends of the Earth: David Attenborough reveals the vast wilderness of the polar regions. At the North Pole, polar bears court and the sun returns after six months of dark.
Spring: Landmark nature series. See warmth and life return to these magical ice worlds as spring arrives in the polar regions and the sun appears after an absence of five months.
Summer: David Attenborough's visually stunning nature series. The sun never sets over summer in the polar regions. See how hordes of animals exploit this brief window of plenty.
Autumn: Witness how solar landscapes change as the big freeze returns. Most animals leave on epic journeys, some battle to breed and for a few it is a time of opportunity.
Winter: During winter most animals abandon the polar regions, but a few extreme survivors remain. This is the story of their battles to endure the planet's harshest winters.
The Last Frontier: The penultimate part of David Attenborough's acclaimed nature series. This episode looks at us humans, one of the polar regions' most ingenious inhabitants.
To the Ends of the Earth: David Attenborough reveals the vast wilderness of the polar regions. At the North Pole, polar bears court and the sun returns after six months of dark.

Bentley T1/Fiesta XR2: Dave's son Jack is heading out to Cheshire to collect two cars with a 35-year age difference. And luckily for Mathewsons, Lucy knows exactly what has been brought in.
